items.markText: Much wants more and loses all.
Look and see which way the wind blows before you commit yourself.
If you are wise you wonâ€™t be deceived by the innocent airs of those whom you have once found to be dangerous.
Do not count your chickens before they are hatched.
We may often be of more consequence in our own eyes than in the eyes of our neighbors.
Betray a friend, and youâ€™ll often find you have ruined yourself.
Better poverty without a care than wealth with its many obligations.
Evil wishes, like fowls, come home to roost.
You may play a good card once too often.
Misfortune tests the sincerity of friendship.
You cannot believe a liar even when he tells the truth.
Show gratitude where gratitude is due.
Heaven helps those who help themselves.
Utility is most menâ€™s test of worth.
There are two sides to every question.
They complain most who suffer least.
Give assistance, not advice, in a crisis.
what is sport to you is death to us.â€
Do not attempt too much at once.
Slow and steady wins the race.
A man is known by the company he keeps.
What is worth most is often valued least.
The quarrels of friends are the opportunities of foes.
whatever is bad has got to be destroyed, no matter how slight the harm it does.â€
